element.name: musculocutaneous nerve, motor
element.distribution: coracobrachial and biceps brachial muscles, the elbow joint, and skin of radial side of forearm
element.action: flexion and adduction of humerus; flexion and supination of forearm; flexion of arm (short head)

element.name: median nerve, motor
element.origin: lateral and medial cords of brachial PLEXUS-C6-T1
element.distribution: ultimately, skin on front of lateral part of hand, most of flexor muscles of front of forearm, most of short muscles of thumb and elbow joint, and many joints of hand

element.name: median nerve, superficial muscles in foream
element.distribution: pronator teres
element.action: pronates and flexes forearm

element.name: interosseous nerve of forearm, anterior, deep muscles of forearm
element.distribution: pronator quadratus
element.action: pronates forearm

element.name: median nerve, motor, wrist and fingers innervation
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne205.htm PALMAR DIGITAL BRANCHES OF MEDIAN NERVE]

element.name: median nerve, superficial muscles in hand
element.distribution: flexor carpi radialis; palmaris longus
element.action: flexion/abduction of wrist, 2-3 metacarpals; flexion wrist, 2-5 metacarpals

element.name: median nerve, intermediate muscles of foream
element.distribution: flexor digitorum superficialis muscle
element.action: flexion of wrist/fingers, middle phalanges 2-5

element.name: median nerve, lumbricals branches
element.distribution: motor innervation to first and second lumbricals of hand
element.action: extension of interphalageal joints of digits 2-3; flexion of MCP joints

element.name: interosseous nerve of forearm, anterior, hand
element.distribution: flexor digitorum profundus, muscular branches; flexor pollicis longus
element.action: flexion of wrist/fingers, distal phalanges 2-5; flexion of wrist/thumb, distal phalanx 1

element.name: median nerve, recurrent branch
element.distribution: muscles of thenar compartment; opponens pollicis, abductor pollicis brevis
element.action: abduction of thumb; opposition of thumb

element.name: ulnar nerve, motor
element.origin: medial and lateral cords of brachial PLEXUS (C7-T1)
element.distribution: ultimately to skin on front and back of medial part of hand, some flexor muscles on front of forearm, many short muscles of hand, elbow joint, many joints of hand

element.name: ulnar nerve, motor, wrist and fingers innervation
ulnar nerve, muscular branches
element.distribution: flexor carpi ulnaris
element.action: flexion/adduction (ulnar deviation) of wrist, pisiform/hamate/5 metacarpal

element.name: ulnar nerve, superficial branch
element.distribution: palmaris brevis; abductor digiti minimi; opponens digiti minimi
element.action: opposition of digit 5 to thumb; abduction of digit 5; stabilization of skin of palm for gripping

element.name: ulnar nerve, pollicis brevis
element.distribution: flexor pollicis brevis
element.action: flex the thumb

element.name: ulnar nerve, adductor pollicis and lumbrical
element.distribution: adductor pollicis; third and fourth lumbrical muscles
element.action: extension of IP joints; flexion of MCP joints

element.name: ulnar nerve, interossei
element.distribution: palmar interossei; dorsal interossei
element.action: flexion of digit 5; extension of interphalangeal joints of digits 4-5

element.name: ulnar nerve, flexor digiti minimi
element.distribution: flexor digiti minimi
element.action: flexion of thumb - deep head, aids in opposition and adduction

element.name: ulnar nerve, hypothenar muscles
element.distribution: hypothenar muscles
element.action: control motion of little finger, abduction of digits 2-4

element.name: radial nerve, motor
element.origin: posterior cord of brachial PLEXUS (C6-C8, and sometimes C5 and T1)
element.distribution: descending in the back of arm and forearm, it is ultimately distributed to skin on back of arm, forearm, and hand, extensor muscles on back of arm and forearm, and elbow joint and many joints of hand

element.name: radial nerve, upper arm muscular branches
element.distribution: triceps brachii (lateral and medial heads), anconeus, brachioradialis, extensor carpi radialis longus
element.action: extension and abduction (radial deviation) of hand; flexion (brachioradialis)/extension (anconeus) of forearm; extension of forearm; extension of arm (long head)

element.name: radial nerve, deep branch before supinator
element.distribution: extensor carpi radialis brevis, supinator
element.action: supination of forearm (and hand); extension of hand

element.name: interosseous nerve of forearm, posterior
element.origin: continuation of deep branch of radial nerve
element.distribution: extensor digitorum, extensor digiti minimi, extensor carpi ulnaris, abductor/extensor pollicis longus, extensor pollicis brevis, extensor indicis
element.notes: long abductor muscle of thumb, extensor muscles of the thumb and second finger, and wrist and intercarpal joints
element.action: extension of proximal phalanx of thumb; extension and abduction of 5th digit; extension of digits 2-5; extension and adduction (ulnar deviation) of hand; extension of index finger; extension of distal phalanx of thumb; abduction and extension of thumb

element.name: cutaneous nerve of arm, medial
element.distribution: skin on medial and posterior aspects of arm

element.name: cutaneous nerve of forearm, medial
element.origin: medial cord of brachial PLEXUS (C8, T1)
element.distribution: skin of front, medial, and posteromedial aspects of forearm

element.name: musculocutaneous nerve, sensory
element.distribution: coracobrachial and biceps brachial muscles, the elbow joint, and skin of radial side of forearm

element.name: cutaneous nerve of forearm, lateral
element.distribution: skin over radial side of forearm and sometimes an area of skin of dorsum of hand

element.name: median nerve, sensory
element.origin: lateral and medial cords of brachial PLEXUS-C6-T1
element.distribution: ultimately, skin on front of lateral part of hand, most of flexor muscles of front of forearm, most of short muscles of thumb and elbow joint, and many joints of hand

element.name: median nerve, palmar cutaneous branch
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne204.htm PALMAR CUTANEOUS BRANCH OF MEDIAN NERVE]
element.distribution: lateral aspect of skin of palm (but not digits)

element.name: median nerve, digital cutaneous branches
element.distribution: lateral (radial) three and a half digits on the palmar side; index, middle and ring finger on dorsum of the hand

element.name: digital nerves of median nerve, common palmar
element.distribution: thumb, index, middle, and ring fingers, and first two lumbrical muscles

element.name: digital nerves of median nerve, proper palmar
element.distribution: first two lumbrical muscles, skin and joints of both sides and palmar aspect of thumb, index, and middle fingers, radial side of ring finger, and back of distal aspect of these digits

element.name: ulnar nerve, sensory
element.origin: medial and lateral cords of brachial PLEXUS (C7-T1)
element.distribution: ultimately to skin on front and back of medial part of hand, some flexor muscles on front of forearm, many short muscles of hand, elbow joint, many joints of hand

element.name: ulnar nerve, dorsal branch
element.distribution: supplies cutaneous innervation to posterior skin (except nails)

element.name: digital nerves of ulnar nerve, dorsal
element.distribution: skin and joints of medial side of little finger, dorsal aspects of adjacent sides of little and ring fingers and of ring and middle fingers

element.name: ulnar nerve, palmar cutaneous branch
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne18.htm PALMAR CUTANEOUS BRANCH OF ULNAR NERVE]
element.distribution: supplies cutaneous innervation to anterior skin and nails

element.name: digital nerves of ulnar nerve, common palmar number two
element.distribution: little and ring fingers

element.name: digital nerves of ulnar nerve, proper palmar
element.synonyms: proper palmar digital nerves of ulnar nerve
element.origin: the lateral of the two common palmar digital nerves from the superficial branch of the ulnar nerve
element.distribution: skin and joints of adjacent sides of fourth and fifth fingers

element.name: radial nerve, sensory
element.origin: posterior cord of brachial PLEXUS (C6-C8, and sometimes C5 and T1)
element.distribution: descending in the back of arm and forearm, it is ultimately distributed to skin on back of arm, forearm, and hand, extensor muscles on back of arm and forearm, and elbow joint and many joints of hand

element.name: radial nerve, posterior cutaneous nerve of arm
element.distribution: skin on back of arm

element.name: cutaneous nerve of arm, inferior lateral
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne7.htm LOWER LATERAL CUTANEOUS NERVE OF ARM]
element.distribution: skin of lateral surface of lower part of arm

element.name: cutaneous nerve of forearm, posterior
element.distribution: skin of dorsal aspect of forearm

element.name: radial nerve, superficial branch
element.distribution: radial side of thumb (by a digital nerve), skin of radial side and ball of thumb

element.name: digital nerves of radial nerve, dorsal
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne206.htm DORSAL DIGITAL BRANCHES OF SUPERFICIAL RADIAL NERVE]
element.distribution: skin and joints of back of thumb, index finger, and part of middle finger, as far distally as the distal phalanx

element.name: long thoracic nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/longthoracic.htm LONG THORACIC NERVE]; nerve of Bell
element.distribution: descends behind brachial plexus to serratus anterior muscle
element.action: protraction of scapula; upward rotation of glenoid cavity; holds medial border against thoracic wall

element.name: pectoral nerve
element.action: adduction and medial rotation of arm; flexion (clavicular fibers) and extension (sternocostal fibers) of humerus

element.name: lateral pectoral nerve
element.distribution: upper pectoralis major muscle

element.name: medial pectoral nerve
element.distribution: lower pectoralis major muscle, pectoralis minor
element.action: depression of shoulder; downward rotation of scapula

element.name: nerve to levator scapulae
element.distribution: shoulder, levator scapulae
element.action: elevation of scapulae; medial rotation of scapula

element.name: subscapular nerves
element.origin: posterior division of the brachial plexus
element.action: move scapulae

element.name: upper subscapular nerve
element.action: medially rotate shoulder, adduct at shoulder

element.name: lower subscapular nerve
element.distribution: subscapularis, teres major
element.action: adduction, internal rotation and extension of arm

element.name: middle subscapular nerve
element.distribution: latissimus dorsi muscle
element.action: extend and adduct at shoulder, medially rotate at shoulder, and horizontally abduct away from midline

element.name: dorsal scapular nerve
element.distribution: rhomboid muscles and occasionally levator muscle of scapula

element.name: dorsal scapular nerve, branch to rhomboideus minor
element.distribution: rhomboideus minor
element.action: elevation and retraction of scapula; downward rotation of glenoid cavity

element.name: dorsal scapular nerve, branch to rhomboideus major
element.distribution: rhomboideus major
element.action: elevation and retraction of scapula; downward rotation of glenoid cavity

element.name: shoulder nerves, mixed
element.modality: general sensory, flexor motor, extensor motor

element.name: axillary nerve
element.distribution: deltoid and teres minor muscles, skin on back of arm
element.modality: general sensory, flexor motor, extensor motor

element.name: axillary nerve, anterior branch
element.distribution: anterior border of deltoid to provide motor innervation, few small cutaneous branches
element.action: abduction (middle fibers), flexion and internal rotation (anterior fibers)

element.name: axillary nerve, posterior branch
element.distribution: supplies teres minor and posterior part of deltoid
element.action: external rotation of scapula; extension and external rotation (posterior fibers) of humerus

element.name: cutaneous nerve of arm, superior lateral
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/Ne6.htm UPPER LATERAL CUTANEOUS NERVE OF ARM]
element.distribution: skin of back of arm

element.name: axillary nerve, motor branch to triceps brachii
element.distribution: motor branch of long head of triceps brachii
element.action: acts on shoulder joint and is also involved in retroversion and adduction of arm

element.name: suprascapular nerve
element.distribution: descends through suprascapular and spinoglenoid notches and supplies acromioclavicular and shoulder joints, and supraspinous and infraspinous muscles
element.action: external rotation of humerus; abduction of humerus

element.name: subclavian nerve
element.distribution: subclavius muscle and sternoclavicular joint
element.action: possible depresses clavicle; maintains sternoclavicular joint
